meanings.definition: To move in a zigzag pattern.
meanings.sent1: The squirrel zagged through the trees to avoid the owl.
meanings.sent2: The lightning zagged across the sky during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy zagged around the yard, chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts zagged back and forth, unable to focus on one thing.
meanings.sent5: The river zagged through the canyon, creating a beautiful natural design.

meanings.sent1: The car zagged to the left to avoid the pothole.
meanings.sent2: The runner zagged around the other players to reach the finish line first.
meanings.sent3: The cat zagged away from the vacuum cleaner, startled by the noise.
meanings.sent4: His mood zagged from happy to sad in a matter of minutes.
meanings.sent5: The plot of the movie zagged unexpectedly, surprising the audience.
